episodes.title: Uno
episodes.description: Struggling public defender Jimmy McGill constructs an elaborate yet questionable plan for winning back a pair of wealthy potential clients.

episodes.title: Mijo
episodes.description: Jimmy's latest scam has gone horribly wrong and he's face-to-face with violent criminals and being forced to talk his way out of a life-threatening situation.

episodes.title: Nacho
episodes.description: Jimmy must prove that Nacho is innocent when he is wrongly suspected of kidnapping.

episodes.title: Hero
episodes.description: Jimmy makes a bold move against Hamlin in an effort to attract potential clients.

episodes.title: Alpine Shepherd Boy
episodes.description: After a strange encounter with the police, Chuck ends up in the hospital. Jimmy meets up with a series of unruly clients.

episodes.title: Five-O
episodes.description: Mike's days as a police officer in Philadelphia catch up to him when he's questioned about a tragic event from his past.

episodes.title: Bingo
episodes.description: The Kettlemans seek Jimmy as their lawyer after turning down an offer from HHM.

episodes.title: RICO
episodes.description: Jimmy discovers the Sandpiper Retirement Home has been scamming his elderly clients, and prepares to take legal action.

episodes.title: Pimento
episodes.description: Chuck wants to transfer the Sandpiper case to HHM much to Jimmy's dismay. Mike gets a job offer working as a bodyguard.

episodes.title: S1.E10 ∙ Marco
episodes.description: Jimmy seizes an opportunity to reconnect with an old friend; Chuck adjusts to a new way of life.

episodes.title: Switch
episodes.description: Jimmy decides to quit the law after turning down a job at Davis & Main. Mike breaks ties with a former associate.

episodes.title: Cobbler
episodes.description: While Mike attempts to track down Pryce's stolen baseball cards, Jimmy must defend him when the police call him in for further questioning.

episodes.title: Amarillo
episodes.description: Jimmy struggles with client outreach and decides to shoot a TV commercial for Davis & Main. Mike begins an investigation.

episodes.title: Gloves Off
episodes.description: Mike makes a deal with Nacho in regards to his newest job offer. Jimmy and Kim face the repercussions of the TV commercial.

episodes.title: Rebecca
episodes.description: Jimmy chafes under his restrictive work environment; Kim goes to extremes to dig herself from a bottomless hole at HHM.

episodes.title: Bali Ha'i
episodes.description: Jimmy finds comfort in familiarity; Kim receives a life-changing proposal; when he is threatened, Mike finds himself pushed to the limit.

episodes.title: Inflatable
episodes.description: When Mike's hand is forced, he can no longer hide his frustration; Mike and Jimmy work together to keep the peace.

episodes.title: Fifi
episodes.description: Kim hopes to keep the Mesa Verde case, but HHM won't let it go without a fight. Mike stakes out the Salamanca's business.

episodes.title: Nailed
episodes.description: Mike takes a methodical approach to his mission; someone questions Chuck's capabilities; Jimmy faces a personal dilemma.

episodes.title: Klick
episodes.description: Jimmy must make a hard choice; Mike takes control of matters; Hamlin delivers shocking news.

episodes.title: Mabel
episodes.description: As Chuck plots his next move, another lie comes back to haunt Jimmy. A rattled Mike tries to find out who's been tracking his movements - and how.

episodes.title: Witness
episodes.description: Jimmy and Kim hire an assistant; Mike seeks out a mysterious acquaintance; and Chuck uses the law to gain an advantage over Jimmy.

episodes.title: Sunk Costs
episodes.description: Jimmy decides to represent a new client, much to Kim's dismay. Meanwhile, Mike meets a formidable ally who presents him an enticing offer.

episodes.title: Sabrosito
episodes.description: Jimmy calls in a favor from Mike. Meanwhile, new complications disrupt the Salamancas' business; and Chuck and Jimmy struggle to compromise.

episodes.title: Chicanery
episodes.description: Kim and Jimmy face off with Chuck and Howard at the New Mexico Bar Association hearing.

episodes.title: Off Brand
episodes.description: Jimmy is back in the commercial making business. Chuck pushes himself to the limit. Nacho finds himself ensnared in a power struggle.

episodes.title: Expenses
episodes.description: Jimmy tries to settle his debts. Nacho reunites with an old acquaintance. Mike helps Stacey with a project and makes a meaningful connection.

episodes.title: Slip
episodes.description: Jimmy is pushed to desperate measures. Nacho picks up a skill and Mike explores an alliance. Kim stands up to Hamlin.

episodes.title: Fall
episodes.description: Jimmy visits Irene at Sandpiper Crossing to see how the class action lawsuit is going; Chuck and Howard spar over the future of the firm; and Kim faces challenges after deciding to take on a new client.

episodes.title: Lantern
episodes.description: Kim resolves to take some time off from work, while Jimmy does his best to make amends; Nacho takes a major gamble with his future; Hamlin applies pressure on Chuck to finally make a decision.

episodes.title: Smoke
episodes.description: Jimmy struggles to cope with Chuck's tragic incident. Mike ponders his role at Madrigal. Howard makes a startling confession.

episodes.title: Breathe
episodes.description: Jimmy seeks new employment. Gus navigates the fallout from Hector's collapse. Kim endeavors to support Jimmy in the wake of Chuck's death.

episodes.title: Something Beautiful
episodes.description: Jimmy puts a risky plan into motion; as alliances shift, Nacho finds himself in the crosshairs; Kim contemplates her future.

episodes.title: Talk
episodes.description: A restless Jimmy embarks on a new endeavor while Mike burns bridges; Kim pursues her bliss; Nacho tries to survive a turf war.

episodes.title: Quite a Ride
episodes.description: Jimmy identifies a new market for his talents; Mike vets a potential partnership; Kim drives a hard bargain.

episodes.title: Piñata
episodes.description: While Jimmy daydreams about reconstituting Wexler-McGill, Kim sets out to secure her own future; Mike puts a plan into motion for Gus.

episodes.title: Something Stupid
episodes.description: Jimmy runs into a problem as he expands his business that only Kim can solve. Gus gets involved in Hector's medical care. Mike has to deal with a setback.

episodes.title: Coushatta
episodes.description: Jimmy goes to great lengths to right a wrong, as Kim pulls out all the stops for a case; Mike lets his team blow off steam; Nacho receives a visitor.

episodes.title: Wiedersehen
episodes.description: Jimmy attends his reinstatement hearing at the Bar Association; Nacho is forced to make the rounds with Lalo; Mike has cause to worry.

episodes.title: Winner
episodes.description: Lalo tails Mike as he attempts to track down Werner; Jimmy and Kim invoke the memory of Chuck for the Bar Association appeal hearing.

episodes.title: Magic Man
episodes.description: Lalo searches for the mysterious Michael. Now doing business as Saul Goodman, Jimmy unveils an unorthodox strategy that tests Kim's tolerance.

episodes.title: 50% Off
episodes.description: Jimmy's promotional stunt has unintended consequences. Nacho takes extreme measures to earn Lalo's trust. Saul is a success at the courthouse, but still has yet to win Kim over. Simmering with rage and self-loathing, Mike loses his temper.

episodes.title: The Guy for This
episodes.description: Jimmy's business enters uncharted territory. Kim's confidence is tested when she's faced with a legal problem only she can solve. Nacho navigates increased pressure from Gus. Mike continues to spiral.

episodes.title: Namaste
episodes.description: As Jimmy doubles down on "Saul Goodman", a deeply conflicted Kim brings him an interesting proposition. Gus makes a sacrifice in order to play the long game. Mike attempts to smooth things over with his family.

episodes.title: Dedicado a Max
episodes.description: As she and Jimmy grow closer over their campaign to help a client, Kim makes a surprising call; Mike is restless during his out-of-town recuperation.

episodes.title: Wexler v. Goodman
episodes.description: Kim has a change of heart, but Saul is determined to stick it to Mesa Verde; Mike turns the heat up on Lalo; Nacho attempts to enlist support from above.

episodes.title: JMM
episodes.description: Jimmy and Kim build a legal firewall with help from Huell; Kim sets things straight with her clients as Jimmy is compromised by his; Gus calms troubled waters in service of his plot to build an empire; Mike does damage control.

episodes.title: Bagman
episodes.description: When a simple errand for a client goes sideways, Jimmy is pushed to the limit; Mike takes measures to contain the wrath of the cartel; Lalo gets an unexpected visitor.

episodes.title: Bad Choice Road
episodes.description: In the wake of Jimmy's traumatic misadventure, Kim takes stock of what is important; Jimmy attempts to return to business as usual, but it's more difficult than anticipated; Gus and Mike set a plan in motion.

episodes.title: Something Unforgivable
episodes.description: Jimmy and Kim make a sideways move that takes a serious turn; Nacho gets closer to the cartel than he'd like.

episodes.title: Wine and Roses
episodes.description: Nacho runs for his life. Saul and Kim hatch a plan to mess with Howard. Mike questions his allegiances.

episodes.title: Carrot and Stick
episodes.description: Kim and Saul enlist some familiar faces in their scheme to get Howard. Harsh realities dawn on Nacho. Gus investigates his suspicions.

episodes.title: Rock and Hard Place
episodes.description: Still on the run, Nacho is forced to choose where his loyalties lie. Saul must decide whether he wants to remain a "friend of the cartel" after his reputation is called into question. Gus and Mike ready the team for a meet.

episodes.title: Hit and Run
episodes.description: Despite assurances from the cartel, Gus takes extreme measures to protect himself against looming threats. Kim and Saul enlist the help of a local pro to put on a show for Cliff Main. Howard seeks outside counsel.

episodes.title: Black and Blue
episodes.description: While business booms for Jimmy, the vise tightens on the cat-and-mouse game between Gus and Lalo.

episodes.title: Axe and Grind
episodes.description: Kim and Jimmy enlist a knowledgeable contact; Howard scrutinizes Jimmy's business practices.

episodes.title: Plan and Execution
episodes.description: Jimmy and Kim deal with a last-minute snag in their plan; Lalo is forced to make an unexpected move.

episodes.title: Point and Shoot
episodes.description: An unexpected visitor forces Jimmy and Kim to face the consequences of their actions.

episodes.title: Fun and Games
episodes.description: Gus attempts to smooth things over with the cartel while Mike ties up loose ends as Jimmy and Kim deal with the repercussions of their actions.

episodes.title: Nippy
episodes.description: A lost dog leads to a new friend. A new player gets in the game.

episodes.title: Breaking Bad
episodes.description: The partners escalate their enterprise to new levels.

episodes.title: Waterworks
episodes.description: The stakes are raised when a discovery is made that will send shockwaves far and wide.

episodes.title: Saul Gone
episodes.description: Revelations. Regrets. RICO violations. Jimmy's worlds - and identities - converge in one final showdown.
